text: Morris Mac Davis (January 21, 1942 – September 29, 2020) was an American country music singer-songwriter, guitarist and actor. His early work writing for Elvis Presley produced the hits "Memories", "In the Ghetto", "Don't Cry Daddy", and "A Little Less Conversation". He was also known for his solo hit "Baby, Don't Get Hooked on Me". Davis died on Nashville, Tennessee on September 29, 2020 from a heart attack caused by heart surgery, aged 78.‘In the Ghetto’ Songwriter Mac Davis Dead at 78 ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:American country singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American country guitarists Category:American television actors Category:American movie actors Category:American voice actors Category:Musicians from Texas Category:Singers from Texas Category:Writers from Texas Category:Actors from Texas Category:People from Lubbock, Texas
title: Mac Davis
